children.text: The join in the gutter has been installed with a lap not in the direction of flow to the outlet, which has the potential to leak.
The Victorian Building Authority’s, Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 7.04 Joints in gutters states that
‘Unless documented otherwise, gutters are defective if they have joints lapped less than 25mm. Laps that are not in the direction of flow to the outlet are defective’ .
This section of gutter must be properly replaced with the correct lap direction so it cannot leak.
